intro: Triainolepis brevituba, commonly known as the short-tubed triainolepis, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology and unique floral structure. The plant typically grows as an understory species in humid, shaded forest environments. Its small, clustered flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
